Subject: possible bug in Heritrix.java in Heritrix2-trunk
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=201621789; y=5cX8Kp8VO1wPhJ6O1H9bkWfMmr8cafW05oPF0waI4iUjzbsAoA

Hello,
I am trying to integrate Heritrix in a new project.
I chose Heritrix2 because of the new redesign.
First I tried version 2.0.2, but
http://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER-1576 blocks a feature that I
need (max-bytes-download).
So I did checkout from SVN, but then I encountered a problem at startup.
Running inside Eclipse with the following startup params:

-p 8999 -a xxxx

the program exits with the following message:

Unless --no-web-ui is specified, you must specify an admin password
for the web UI using --webui-admin.


Debugging the code I noticed that inside the main method all hasOption
control parameters have been substituted with the long names (e.g.
line 223

  if (cl.hasOption('h')) {

has become

 if (cl.hasOption("help")) {

IMO this is not correct as hasOption param should be the short name as
stated in the javadoc
http://commons.apache.org/cli/apidocs/org/apache/commons/cli/CommandLine.html#hasOption(java.lang.String)

Going back to short names the program works correctly.

Do you also think this is a bug?
If so, unless you are planning to fix it soon I'll be happy to submit a patch.

Thank you for your attention and for your project which is great!

Marco
